pages.text: Frondophyllas grandis comes from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found from Newfoundland, Canada. It is a tree-like petalonamid lifeform, and could grow up to over 1 m in height, making it possibly the tallest Ediacaran known, and also may have partook in filter feeding from the surrounding water.

The generic name derives from the Latin word 'frondis', to mean 'leafy branch'; and the Greek word 'phyllon', to mean 'leaf'. Its specific name derives from the Latin Word 'grandis', to mean 'great/grand'.
